Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 行商人
Entry.EnglishText: Peddler

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: 村人の声
Entry.EnglishText: Villager's Voice

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: アニカマル
Entry.EnglishText: Anikamal

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: いらっしゃいませ。 さて、何だったかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Welcome! See anything you want?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:12C> 武器を買う 防具を買う 道具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:12C>Buy Weapons Buy Armor Buy Items Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: じゃあ、またよろしく！
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you, come again!

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器はウチでよろしく！
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks for buying my weapons!

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具はウチでよろしく！！
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks for buying my armor!

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具はウチでよろしく！
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks for buying my items!

Entry.JapaneseText: 医者ねえ……僕はよそ者だから、 よくわからないんだよね。
Entry.EnglishText: A doctor...? I'm not from around here, so I wouldn't know.

Entry.JapaneseText: 病気なんだってね。 残念ながら、薬は扱ってないんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, someone's sick? Sorry, but I don't have medicine with me right now.

Entry.JapaneseText: 僕は何ともないんだけどさ、 この村の人たちみんな、 ガジュマだ、ヒューマだって、 互いの文句ばっかり言い合ってるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm ambivalent towards it all, but the villagers here have been complaining about "Huma this" and "Gajuma that."

Entry.JapaneseText: 今におおごとになるんじゃないかって、 心配してるんだけど……僕の力じゃ 何もできないし……ねえ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm worried that this might blow up into something big, but it's not like I can do anything about it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちのような旅人が来ると 安心するんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Seeing travelers like you come always gives me a peace of mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: 旅をしてる人は、種族の事を 気にしてない場合が多いからね。 気持ちの問題なのかな……
Entry.EnglishText: Most travelers I've met usually don't care about things like race. I wonder if that's just how most travelers are...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか知らないけど、 村の人たちはヒューマを 追い出してたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I don't know what happened, but apparently the villagers chased the Huma out of town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマ？ さあ、どこ行ったんだろうね……
Entry.EnglishText: Where are the Huma? I don't know...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは あんまこの村に来ない方が いいんじゃない？
Entry.EnglishText: Wouldn't it be better if Huma didn't come to this village?

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、君たちの 勝手だけどね。
Entry.EnglishText: Well, you're free to do what you like.

Entry.JapaneseText: え？ オアシスに？ 気をつけて 行っておいで。
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? You're going to the Oasis? Take care!

Entry.JapaneseText: さっきの君たちのお説教、 スカッとしたよ！
Entry.EnglishText: I found what you said earlier very refreshing.

Entry.JapaneseText: 村の人たちも反省してくれると いいんだけどねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: I just hope the villagers would also take it to heart...

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちがこの前、村人のみんなを 叱ってから、少しずつだけど、 村の雰囲気が変わり始めてるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Ever since you guys came here and reprimanded everyone, things have slowly started changing around here.

Entry.JapaneseText: それぞれ思うところはある みたいなんだけど、今のままじゃ ダメだって、みんな思ってる……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like everyone has their own thoughts on the matter, but they all think that it could be better.

Entry.JapaneseText: この地鳴りが始まってから、 急に売上が伸びてるんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Ever since these earthquakes started happening, I've seen an increase in my sales.

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちも早く買わないと 商品がなくなっちゃうよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You guys should also hurry and buy some before I run out of stock!

Entry.JapaneseText: これから何が起こるかわからないよ。 備えあれば憂いなし！ イロイロ買ってよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Who knows what will happen from here on out! Make sure to buy everything you need to be prepared!

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちも早く買わないと 商品がなくなっちゃうよ！
Entry.EnglishText: You guys should also hurry and buy some before I run out of stock!

Entry.JapaneseText: いつもここにいるように見えるけど、 ちゃんと仕入れに出かけてるから、 商品は古くはないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Look, you might think I'm here all the time, but I'm always leaving to restock. My products are always new!

Entry.JapaneseText: いつでも、よろしく！
Entry.EnglishText: Come again!

Entry.JapaneseText: 奥のテントにいるヒューマ…… 何してるのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what that Huma by the tent is doing...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 怪しいわー……
Entry.EnglishText: He's suspicious...

Entry.JapaneseText: 触らないで！ 近寄らないで！ 私はまだ死にたくないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: D-Don't touch me! I-I don't want to die yet!

Entry.JapaneseText: 奥のテントにいたヒューマ、 冒険家だったんですってね。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently, the Huma who lives in the tent over there is an adventurer.

Entry.JapaneseText: カッコいい……
Entry.EnglishText: How cool...

Entry.JapaneseText: 考え事してるの。 邪魔しないでくれる？
Entry.EnglishText: Can you please not? I'm thinking here.

Entry.JapaneseText: うるさいな。 アッチ行って！
Entry.EnglishText: You're annoying! Go somewhere else!

Entry.JapaneseText: 出てけったら出てけ！
Entry.EnglishText: Get out of here!

Entry.JapaneseText: 冷たくして ゴメンなさい……
Entry.EnglishText: I-I'm sorry that I was so cold to you...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ガジュマなんか、 いなくなればいいのよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Sure would be nice if all Gajuma disappeared...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマのあの釣りバカが…… 私にお水を汲ませてくれないの。 いなくなるのを待ってるんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: That stupid Gajuma fishing over there won't let me draw water from the pond! I have to wait until he's gone...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマなんて…… ガジュマなんかいるから……！
Entry.EnglishText: All because there's a Gajuma there...!

Entry.JapaneseText: あの釣り好き男…… 水を汲んでもいいって言うけど…… 顔を合わせるのも気まずくって……
Entry.EnglishText: That guy over there said that I could draw water from the pond, but...it's hard to face him...

Entry.JapaneseText: この地鳴り…… 何かの災害の前触れかしら…… 水を汲み貯めておかなくちゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: This earthquake... I wonder if some disaster is coming? I-I've got to hurry and get water...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 今、国中で天変地異が 起こってるのよね……？
Entry.EnglishText: There's disasters happening all over the country right now, right...?

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな風になってから、 この村はまとまり始めてるの…… 私はみんなのための水汲み係。
Entry.EnglishText: If something like that happens here, this village will stand as one! I'll go and fetch water for everyone!

Entry.JapaneseText: 他の町も、助け合ったり してるといいんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I hope that those who live in other towns will be willing to help one another...

Entry.JapaneseText: 毎日毎日コンコン、コンコンって 水の湧き出る音が聞こえるのよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Each and every day, I always hear the sound of gushing water.

Entry.JapaneseText: それを聞いてると癒されて…… だから、いつもこうして 水を汲みに来るの。
Entry.EnglishText: I find it so relaxing that I'm always coming here to fetch water.

Entry.JapaneseText: この村に 医者はいないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Is there a doctor in this village?

Entry.JapaneseText: さあ、どうかな。
Entry.EnglishText: Beats me.

Entry.JapaneseText: 薬屋さんでも いいんだけど？
Entry.EnglishText: What about a pharmacy?

Entry.JapaneseText: さあ、どうかな。
Entry.EnglishText: Beats me.

Entry.JapaneseText: その言い方は何だ!! 病人がいるんだぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: What's with your tone!? Someone is sick, you know!

Entry.JapaneseText: そうか、 それは大変だな。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, that's too bad.

Entry.JapaneseText: 貴様……！
Entry.EnglishText: Why you...!

Entry.JapaneseText: やめてヨ！ <Eugene>らしくない！
Entry.EnglishText: Stop! <Eugene>, this isn't like you!

Entry.JapaneseText: くっ……
Entry.EnglishText: Grr...

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん……
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうすればいいんだ!? 早くしなければ、<Annie>は……
Entry.EnglishText: What should we do? If we're not quick, <Annie> will...

Entry.JapaneseText: 病人？ そりゃ大変だ。
Entry.EnglishText: Someone's sick? That's unfortunate.

Entry.JapaneseText: 出てけって言われたら おとなしく出てけよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Look, I'm telling you to leave so just shut up and go!

Entry.JapaneseText: ちと反省中……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm doing a little introspection...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここにいつも水を汲みに来る ヒューマの女……うっとうしいから 帰れって怒鳴ってやったんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: That Huma woman that always comes here to draw water is irritating, so I yelled at her to go home.

Entry.JapaneseText: そしたら、家に引きこもって 出てこなくなったんだ。 せいせいしたぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: I would be so relieved if she just shut herself in her house and never came out again.

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえ……ヘンだな…… ヒューマなのに気にならないな。 ま、いっか……
Entry.EnglishText: You're strange... You're a Huma, and yet I'm not bothered by you... Well, whatever.

Entry.JapaneseText: 釣りのジャマなんだよ！ 魚が逃げるだろ、どっか行け！
Entry.EnglishText: Go somewhere else! You're chasing away the fish!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたもガジュマなら、 ヒューマなんかと歩くな。
Entry.EnglishText: Listen here, if you're a Gajuma, then you better stop travelling with Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとしての 誇りを持ちな！
Entry.EnglishText: Don't you have any pride?

Entry.JapaneseText: この村はガジュマの村になったんだ！ ヒューマはさっさと出ていけ!!
Entry.EnglishText: This is a Gajuma village from now on! Huma like you don't belong here!

Entry.JapaneseText: 今頃、ヒューマの連中、 オアシスでバイラスに…… いいざまだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Hah, those Huma scum are going to get eaten in the Oasis... Absolutely perfect!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あ、あんたたちに叱られて イロイロ考えてるところさ…… 悩みの答が釣れるといいんだけどな……
Entry.EnglishText: I've been thinking, ever since you reprimanded me... If only I could fish out the answer in this pond...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマ…… 一度気にし始めたら、 忘れるわけには行かないよな……
Entry.EnglishText: Once you start fretting about Gajuma and Huma, it'll never leave your mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: 前は何も考えなくても うまくやってたのにな……
Entry.EnglishText: Personally, everything was all well back when I never paid it much attention.

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたたちヒューマは、 ガジュマの事、どう思ってるんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: As a Huma, what do you think of us Gajuma?

Entry.JapaneseText: 口には出さないけど…… どこかでバカにしたり、 嫌ってたりするんじゃないのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: I know you won't say it out loud, but do you hate or make fun of us...?

Entry.JapaneseText: この音が鳴り出してから、 さっぱり魚が釣れなくなったよ。 いや、前からか……
Entry.EnglishText: I haven't been able to catch any fish ever since this noise started... No, perhaps even before?

Entry.JapaneseText: どっちでもいいけどさ、 なんだか気味が悪い音だな……
Entry.EnglishText: Either way, this sound is unsettling...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとかヒューマとか 考えるのを、とりあえずやめたんだ。 世の中、大騒ぎになってるしな……
Entry.EnglishText: I've stopped fretting over Gajuma and Huma stuff for now. Apparently, there's something terrible happening...

Entry.JapaneseText: その前に、村を守らなきゃと 思ってさ……ヒューマと手を 組む事になったとしても……
Entry.EnglishText: I have to cooperate with Huma to protect this village before something happens...

Entry.JapaneseText: そのために、オレは食料を 調達してるってわけさ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I'm stocking up on ingredients.

Entry.JapaneseText: なーんにも釣れないな……
Entry.EnglishText: Nothing's biting...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここ一週間くらい、 ずっとボウズだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I haven't been able to catch anything for a week.

Entry.JapaneseText: 魚いないのかな……？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if there just aren't any fish...?

Entry.JapaneseText: うわあっ!!
Entry.EnglishText: Waah!!

Entry.JapaneseText: しまった!! まだ、いたか……！
Entry.EnglishText: Damnit! There's more?!

Entry.JapaneseText: 奥の方だヨ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Over there!

Entry.JapaneseText: あっちにもいます！
Entry.EnglishText: They're over here too!

Entry.JapaneseText: くっ…… キリがない……！
Entry.EnglishText: Damn... There's no end to them...!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『アニカマル式 つぼ』 アニカマルの赤土を使って焼き上げた 厚みがあるのにふんわり軽いつぼ。 焼くのに高度な技術を要する。 今では国中探しても四人しか作れない。 後継者不足が深刻な問題。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Anikamal Ceremonial Jar - Made out of baked red clay from Anikamal, it's extremely light despite its thickness. Crafting it requires a fair amount of skill. Nowadays, there are only four people in the country who can make them. The lack of people who are learning the craft is a growing concern.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『アニカマルの紋章』 壁に描かれているのはアニカマルの紋章。 古代から受け継がれている。 アニカマルの樹を象形化したもので、 三つの○は「力と技と団結」を表している。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Anikamal Crest - Anikamal's Crest is drawn on the wall. Passed down from ancient times, its design, which resembles the Anikamal Tree, has three circles symbolizing power, skill, and unity.
